snippet: A state appellate court in Brooklyn has ordered the family to return an ancient artifact to a German museum, turning on its head the familiar scenario of Holocaust survivors suing to reclaim property.
abstract: State appellate court in Brooklyn orders the family of Holocaust survivor Riven Flamenbaum to return an ancient gold tablet to the Vorderasiatisches Museum in Berlin; it is unclear how Flamenbaum came to possess the tablet, which according to court papers, was found to be missing from the museum at the close of World War II.
lead_paragraph: A state appellate court in Brooklyn has ordered the family to return an ancient artifact to a German museum, turning on its head the familiar scenario of Holocaust survivors suing to reclaim property.

headline.seo: Court Tells Holocaust Survivor’s Family to Return Gold Tablet
headline.main: Nazi Victim’s Family Told to Return Artifact
headline.print_headline: Nazi Victim’s Family Told to Return Artifact
